renderedFields.description:
As a developer, I want less bugs in #sentry-cash, so that I can focus on the important ones.

There's a recurring Sentry error that happens when an onboarding in Sandbox or Production goes to the NOA_BUYER status. It doesn't cause anything, but because it happens often it makes the #sentry-cash channel less useful.

There's two lines that causes this error:

default:
    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Onboarding with invalid status: " + onboarding.getStatus());

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/205b86b110163e96c6cbf927c0430bcaa3d61e8b/early-payments-service/src/main/java/com/tradeshift/earlypayments/onboarding/service/RFOnboardingNotificationService.java#L204-L205

We don't send an email for every onboarding status. The software should not assume its an exceptional circumstance. Instead, the software can log a message or something like that.

default:
    LOGGER.debug("I don't have an email to send for onboarding with status " + onboarding.getStatus());
    emailTemplatesWithAttachments = List.of();

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
• Writes to RabbitMQ which result in 'channel write buffer full' error will be retried.
• Event order is maintained
• Publishing will retry/resume after the tradeshift-salesforce-events service restarts
renderedFields.description:
As a developer I want to ensure that RabbitMQ events that failed to send due to write buffer full error will still be delivered so that all Opportunities will result in enrollments created within EP.

If the call to channel.publish() (send a RabbitMQ event) fails due to write buffer full, currently we do not retry the publish and the event will not be sent. The correct behavior is to listen for a 'drain' event, and then call publish again.

To achieve this while maintaining correct event order, the channel.publish() call should be applied to events
stored in the database, in the order that they were recorded. If a channel write buffer fail happens, publishing should pause until a drain event is received, at which point the publish processing should continue from the failed event.

Continued failures should be retried using an exponential backoff. If the tradeshift-salesforce-events service is restarted, publishing should continue from the last event in the database that has not been sent to RabbitMQ.

More details can be found at the url below:

http://www.squaremobius.net/amqp.node/channel_api.html#channel_publish

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
• Events are stored in a database along with replayId
• Subscribing to Salesforce events uses the latest replayId
• Opportunity events are not lost if they're sent while tradeshift-salesforce-events is down
renderedFields.description:
As a developer I want to ensure that if the tradeshift-salesforce-events pod is being restarted when an Opportunity event occurs, the event will be processed when the pod comes back up so that an
enrollment is within EP.

Currently we subscribe to Salesforce events using a replayId -1. This means that only Opportunity events created after listener registration will be received. The correct behavior is to store the events with replayIds as they are received and use the last event's replayId when subscribing. This means that any Opportunity events sent during the interim will be received.

More details can be found at the url below:

https://github.com/jsforce/jsforce/blob/2f14bf33dfb81ae2637a4f0b4ab51968d275a0af/lib/api/streaming-extension.js#L66

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

renderedFields.customfield_10031: • Connection and channel lifecycles matches amqp recommendation.
renderedFields.description:
As a developer I want to ensure no unnecessary RabbitMQ Connections and Channels are created so that tradeshift-salesforce-events performs optimally.

Currently we create and close a RabbitMQ Connection and Channel for each Salesforce opportunity event received. The correct behavior is to create and re-use a single Connection per process and a single Channel per thread.

More details can be found at the url below:

https://www.cloudamqp.com/blog/2018-01-19-part4-rabbitmq-13-common-errors.html

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

renderedFields.description:
As a developer, I want to limit the number of exceptions that can derail creating an enrollment, so that there's as little of manual work as possible.

https://sentry.io/organizations/tradeshiftcom/issues/2182264033/?project=1353182&referrer=slack

So this error is because early-payments made a request to the TS backend, which returned a 503. On top of the code being pretty messy, it doesn't look like it retries if the first request fails.

I think the easiest solution is to add a retry mechanism to the existing code. There's an example of using the @Retryable annotation in the virus scan service

@Retryable(maxAttempts = 5, backoff = @Backoff(delay = 500, maxDelay = 3000, multiplier = 2.5D, random = true))

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/dce9b1bbcdabfebc2522a7f6d3a35d23412cbf97/early-payments-service/src/main/java/com/tradeshift/earlypayments/tsapi/service/TSVirusScanService.java#L50

That may be able to annotate this method

public Optional<UserAccountInfo> getUserAccountInfo(UUID companyAccountId, UUID userId) {

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/dce9b1bbcdabfebc2522a7f6d3a35d23412cbf97/early-payments-service/src/main/java/com/tradeshift/earlypayments/tsapi/service/RemoteUserAccountService.java#L40

Which would at least make the method retry.

The developer can also consider removing the if block in the exception catch and always return an Optional.empty():

        } catch (HttpClientErrorException ex) {
            Log.WARN(getLogMessage(ex, companyAccountId, userId));
            return Optional.empty();
        }

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/master/early-payments-service/src/main/java/com/tradeshift/earlypayments/tsapi/service/RemoteUserAccountService.java#L54-L59

And then come up with a different name for the auditor. Possibly just the tradeshift user ID.

renderedFields.description:
As an OPS person I want EP to serve an enrollment packet which contains the documents specified.

The packet should be a zip.

It should contain the following docs:

Data PDF Exists?
Seller enrollment letter Yes
NOA Template with vIBANS (template being finalized) Yes
Seller's submitted bank details No
Terms acceptance log ( EN-560 To Do ) No
Tradeshift ToS (accepted by the user) Yes
Early Payment Terms (document being finalized) No
Blackstar RSA (document being finalized) No

Create an EnrollmentPacketService (or similar) which retrieves all necessary pdfs and returns them within a zip file.

Steps to implement:

  1. Create an endpoint to retrieve the enrollment packet zip file
  2. Restrict access for program manager
  3. Update acceptance test to cover this functionality

renderedFields.customfield_10031: • All fields specified above are available within EP Manager and stored in the specified locations.
renderedFields.description:
As an ops user I want the seller acceptance log fields to be available in EP so that they can be used to populate the seller acceptance log in EPManager.

The following is a list of the fields needed in the seller acceptance log:

  • Seller First and Last Name
    • Originating from: Tradeshift Account Service, concatenating firstName and lastName
    • Stored in: OnboardingTermsAccepted.name Journal event
  • Seller User UUID
    • Originating from: EP DB Table users, column user_id, through the security principal
    • Stored in: should be added to the OnboardingTermsAccepted Journal event.
  • Seller Company Name
    • Originating from: Tradeshift Company Account Service
    • Stored in: SelectedOnboarding
  • Seller Company TS UUID
    • Originating from: EP DB Table users, column ts_company_account_id, through the security principal
    • Stored in: should be added to the OnboardingTermsAccepted Journal event.
  • Seller User Email
    • Originating from: Tradeshift Account Service, username
    • Stored in: OnboardingTermsAccepted.email Journal event
  • Seller IP address
    • Originating from: Originating IP, through the session Authentication object
    • Stored in: OnboardingTermsAccepted.ipAddress Journal event
  • Date & Time of Acceptance
    • Originating from: Generated at the time the Journal event is created
    • Stored in: OnboardingTermsAccepted.created Journal event
  • Tradeshift ToS Version
    • Originating from: Terms microservice DB
    • Stored in: EP DB onboarding_documents table
  • Tradeshift EP ToS Version
    • Originating from: Terms microservice DB
    • Stored in: EP DB onboarding_documents table
  • Blackstar RSA PDF Version
    • Originating from: Terms microservice DB
    • Stored in: EP DB onboarding_documents table

The following is a proposed list of steps to store the fields needed for the seller terms acceptance log:

  • Add 'version number' column in the onboarding_documents table
  • Add missing fields to journals
  • Migrate the database to assign a version number to existing documents
  • Migrate the OnboardingTermsAccepted journal events to add the missing fields

comments.body: Journal events use onboarding id as aggregate id, which can be used to lookup the onboarding to retrieve values for the journal migration.

renderedFields.description:
As a
program manager
I want
an enrollment to still be made if getting documents for it fails
So that
I'm not SOL if something in getting the documents breaks

I think it's a pretty straightforward fix.

Right now, we always expect (block) for a response from Salesforce. If there's a problem, the return value evaluates to null.

private static ContentVersion[] getContentVersions(TokenResponse tokenResponse, String opportunityId) {

        String instanceUrl = tokenResponse.getInstanceUrl().toString();

        WebClient webClient = WebClient.builder().baseUrl(instanceUrl).build();

        return webClient.get()
                .uri("/services/apexrest/ContentVersion?linkedEntityId={opportunity_id}", opportunityId)
                .header("Authorization",  "Bearer " + tokenResponse.getAccessToken())
                .retrieve()
                .bodyToMono(ContentVersion[].class)
                .onErrorResume(WebClientResponseException.class, ServiceUtility::errorHandler)
                .block();
    }

I think if we change to an optional response (blockOptional),

private static Optional<ContentVersion[]> getContentVersions(TokenResponse tokenResponse, String opportunityId) {

        String instanceUrl = tokenResponse.getInstanceUrl().toString();

        WebClient webClient = WebClient.builder().baseUrl(instanceUrl).build();

        return webClient.get()
                .uri("/services/apexrest/ContentVersion?linkedEntityId={opportunity_id}", opportunityId)
                .header("Authorization",  "Bearer " + tokenResponse.getAccessToken())
                .retrieve()
                .bodyToMono(ContentVersion[].class)
                .onErrorResume(WebClientResponseException.class, ServiceUtility::errorHandler)
                .blockOptional(TIMEOUT_DURATION);
    }

We can change the code in the OnboardingCaseAdapter to expect an optional value.

    private List<DocumentContent> getContentDataDocumentContents(String opportunityId) {
        ContentVersion[] contentVersions = contentVersionService.getContentVersions(opportunityId)
                .orElse(getEmptyContentVersions());
        return List.of(contentVersions).stream()
                .map(this::getContentDataDocumentContent)
                .collect(Collectors.toList());
    }


    private ContentVersion[] getEmptyContentVersions() {
        return new ContentVersion[] { };
    }

Then, even if there's a problem getting the list of ContentVersions, the software will still finish making the enrollment.

renderedFields.description:
As a
Developer
I want
To run the onboarding acceptance tests in my IDE
So that
I can make sure my code runs before I send it to the server

To implement the document downloading from Salesforce, I had to have Wiremock return a response with a URL that's used later.

When a developer runs early-payments locally, they use the haproxy-local.cfg. When Jenkins runs early-payments in the component tests, I suspect it uses haproxy.cfg.

There's a critical difference between the two:
haproxy.cfg

server wiremock wiremock:8080

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/0a7e222458c4d6789388d6da368cf19615f5b80e/early-payments-testsuite/src/test/resources/haproxy/haproxy.cfg#L27

haproxy-local.cfg

server wiremock localhost:8080

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/master/early-payments-testsuite/src/test/resources/haproxy/haproxy-local.cfg#L27

So local expects requests to Wiremock at http://localhost, and Jenkins expects requests at http://wiremock. Because the wiremock is static, I have to have it as one or the either:

      "instance_url": "http://wiremock:8080/salesforce"

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/0a7e222458c4d6789388d6da368cf19615f5b80e/early-payments-testsuite/src/test/resources/wiremock/mappings/salesforce/services/oauth2/token/POST.json#L13

If you change that mock to return http://localhost:8080/salesforce, the test will run fine locally. However I think we want to not have to make manual changes to run a test.

I think the easiest way out is to do something like stubbing in OnboardingAcceptanceITCase in the @BeforeAll method.

@BeforeAll
void setupAll() {
    WiremockHelper.serveSalesforceOauthToken();
}
public class WiremockHelper {
    public static serveSalesforceOauthToken() {
        if (isJenkinsBuild) {
            // Stub with http://wiremock
        } else {
            // Stub with http://localhost
        }
    }
}

I couldn't find a way to read the host name for wiremock from the environment. I did see this in the POM file:

<hosts.wiremock>http://${docker.host.address}:${ports.wiremock}</hosts.wiremock>

https://github.com/Tradeshift/tradeshift-early-payments/blob/master/early-payments-testsuite/pom.xml#L91

Which could possibly be a lead to reading the hostname, but I’m not sure.

renderedFields.description:
As a
developer
I want
to cache the access token from salesforce
So I
can reduce the number of calls to Salesforce

So the TokenResponse you get back from Salesforce has a field, `issued_at`. It expires at exactly `issued_at + EXPIRATION_OFFSET`, and `EXPIRATION_OFFSET` is always 180.

So if you add `issued_at` to the TokenResponse class, you'll get back when the token was issued. You can save that as an attribute on the class.

Then, when `getTokenResponse` is called, you can compare the cached tokenResponse's issuedAt Instant, plus the EXPIRATION_OFFSET seconds to the current time. If it's expired, get a new tokenResponse, otherwise return the existing tokenResponse.

@Value
@Builder
public class TokenResponse {
    @JsonProperty("access_token") String accessToken;
    @JsonProperty("instance_url") URL instanceUrl;
    @JsonProperty("issued_at") Instant issuedAt;
}
public class SalesforceAuthenticationClient {
  private Optional<TokenResponse> tokenResponse;
  
  public tokenResponse getTokenResponse() {
    if (isExpired(tokenResponse)) {
      tokenResponse = getTokenResponse(Instant.now());
    }
    return tokenResponse;
  }

  private boolean isExpired(TokenResponse tokenResponse) {
    return tokenResponse.getIssuedAt().plusSeconds(EXPIRATION_OFFSET).isAfterNow();
  }
}

Or something like that. Maybe something about the class being thread-safe?

renderedFields.description:
One of the tests in fintech-apps/cypress/integration/EPManager/raistone-program/create-program.spec.js fails intermittently on Jenkins.

AssertionError: Timed out retrying: Expected to find content: 'No programs to show' within the element: <div#programs.ts-table.ts-spirit.ts-table-list.ts-clickable.ts-hasrows.ts-hascols> is the error thrown. After looking at the code, it seems that the issue stems from the fact that the call to getPrograms is mocked twice. In one instance, the mocked response returns an array of programs, and in the other it returns an empty array. The mocked response with the list of programs overrides the mocked response with the empty array, as a result the client renders the programs in the table and the assertion looking for No programs to show fails.

The solution for this would involve removing the mocked response with the array of programs, so that only one mocked response remains and the assertion looking for No programs to show no longer fails.

I've also left a couple of links below showing how this test has failed intermittently on Jenkins more than once.

  • https://ci.ts.sv/blue/organizations/jenkins/pipeline-builds%2Ffintech-apps/detail/PR-978/15/pipeline
  • https://ci.ts.sv/blue/organizations/jenkins/pipeline-builds%2Ffintech-apps/detail/PR-977/10/pipeline
  • https://ci.ts.sv/blue/organizations/jenkins/pipeline-builds%2Ffintech-apps/detail/master/542/pipeline/

Below I’ve linked a video of the test failing. You can see a program listed in the video because the mocked response is not returning an empty array. If the mocked response was set to return an empty array then we would see No programs to show in the table.

  • https://ci.ts.sv/job/pipeline-builds/job/fintech-apps/job/PR-978/15/artifact/cypress/videos/EPManager/raistone-program/create-program.spec.js.mp4

renderedFields.description:
As sales, I want to know which users showed interest in cash after requesting that we ask them later, so that I know everyone I can reach out to.

The current Cash MVP Banner is configured to show the banner to users only once. If we change that to ask every time, then I don't believe our export reports will identify a user who said no the first time and yes the second time.

To test this, clone the Cash MVP Banner flow so you can play around with things without affecting the live flow. Configure it to show the banner to users only once. Use the mock stacks repo and the document manager app.

Use three users for this. The first one should say ask me later. The second one should say they are interested. The third one should say ask me later. Then export the results and see that the report is built correctly, i.e. only one of the users is in the report.

Change the cloned flow to show every time. Using the first user, say they are interested. Using the third user, say ask me later (again). Now export the results and the first user should show up multiple times. When you build the report, I'd expect (but have not tested) that first user does not show up in the report - this is what needs to change.

If no previous reports exist, the report should include the first user twice, the second user once, and the third user twice. If a previous report exists, with the first response from each user, then the second report should include the first user having true for interested and the third user having false for interested.

renderedFields.description: The seller enrollment screen in EPManager currently uses a couple custom built elements to match the design documents. However, there already exists a standardized TSUI `<Board>` component that allows us to match the design without having to implement a custom solution. Implementing this TSUI `<Board>` component helps in standardizing the UI and allows us to get rid of one-off solutions that are less likely to be maintained.

fields.description: The seller enrollment screen in EPManager currently uses a couple custom built elements to match the design documents. However, there already exists a standardized TSUI `<Board>` component that allows us to match the design without having to implement a custom solution. Implementing this TSUI `<Board>` component helps in standardizing the UI and allows us to get rid of one-off solutions that are less likely to be maintained.
fields.summary: Refactor EPManager enrollment screen to implement TSUI board

renderedFields.description:
As an engineer I want a technical requirements document to be written for EN-511 & EN-596 so that they can estimated accurately and to simplify the work.

Note that the current usage of short payment api within cash dashboard makes a request using program id but not seller company id. The usage in EPManager will need to specify the seller company id. To achieve this securely using role an endpoint may need to be created in IEP where the roles live.

Can speak with payments routing team about retrieving the short payments info and funder payments team (Michael) for the credit limits info.

renderedFields.description:
Seller requests to be removed from the program (through a support ticket)

Ops will need to see seller balance, enrollment should end on the day they request termination.

If membership is ended no more invoices will be sent to Aronova, but we do want collections to be going to the funder, so we’ll need a new state while offboarding (Inactive with pending collection), (De-activated)

renderedFields.description:
When filling out the bank details, specifically the Bank Account Country field, typing in that field generates that error.

Login as a seller. Open EPSupplier. View the enrollment on the AWAITING_BANK_INFO state, where the seller is to fill out their bank details. Click on the Bank Account Country field and start typing while holding the click on the field. This is most likely a bug with the FakeSelect component in fintech-apps.

https://sentry.io/organizations/tradeshiftcom/issues/2024237499/?project=1283412 - EPSupplier
https://sentry.io/organizations/tradeshiftcom/issues/2053147134/?project=1283412 - EPManager
